abstract: A federal jury ruled that Johnson & Johnson’s Cordis unit had infringed on a patent for a device used to treat damaged heart tissue.
snippet: A federal jury ruled that Johnson & Johnson’s Cordis unit had infringed on a patent for a device used to treat damaged heart tissue.
lead_paragraph: A jury told Johnson & Johnson on Friday to pay $482 million to a New Jersey radiologist for infringing on a patent on devices to prop open heart arteries.

headline.main: J.&J. Unit Is Told to Pay $482 Million to New Jersey Doctor in Patent Case
headline.print_headline: Jury Awards $482 Million to Doctor In Patent Case Against a J.&J. Unit
